00024 HybfsData::HybfsData(char *_mountp)
00025 {
00026         mountp = _mountp;
00027         doexit = 0;
00028         retval = 0;

00031 int HybfsData::add_branch(const char * branch)
00032 {
00033         struct stat buf;
00034         string *abspath = NULL;
00035         VirtualDirectory *vdir;
00036         int ret;
00037 
00038         abspath = make_absolute(branch);
00039         if(abspath == NULL) {
00040                 return -1;
00041         }
00042         
00043         if (lstat(abspath->c_str(), &buf) == -1) {
00044                 PRINT_ERROR("hybfs: Warning! This branch is not valid!");
00045                 ret = -1;
00046                 goto out;
00047         }
00048         if (!S_ISDIR(buf.st_mode)) {
00049                 PRINT_ERROR("hybfs: Warning! This branch is not a directory!");
00050                 ret = -1;
00051                 goto out;
00052         }
00053 
00054         branches.push_back(*abspath);
00055         
00056         abspath->append(METADIR);
00057         /* check if the directory exists, if not - create */
00058         if (lstat(abspath->c_str(), &buf) == -1) {
00059                 DBG_PRINT("Error at checking directory! Atempt to create one!\n");
00060                 /* TODO get appropriate permisions for our directory */
00061                 if(mkdir(abspath->c_str(),0755)) {
00062                         perror("Failed to create directory: ");
00063                         ret = -1;
00064                         goto out;
00065                 }
00066         }
00067         abspath->append(MAINDB);
00068 
00069         vdir = new VirtualDirectory(abspath->c_str());
00070         if(vdir == NULL) {
00071                 ret = -1;
00072                 goto out;
00073         }
00074 
00075         vdirs.push_back(vdir);
00076         ret = 0;
00077 out:
00078         if(abspath != NULL)
00079                 delete abspath;
00080         
00081         return ret;
00082 }
00083 
00084 int HybfsData::delete_branch(const char * branch)
00085 {
00086         int i, ret;
00087 
00088         ret = 0;
00089         for (i=0; i< (int) branches.size(); i++) {
00090                 if (strncmp(branches[i].c_str(), branch, branches[i].size() )
00091                                 == 0) {
00092                         /* delete the branch path */
00093                         branches.erase(branches.begin()+i, branches.begin()+1+i);
00094                         /* delete the associated vdir handle*/
00095                         vdirs.erase(vdirs.begin()+i, vdirs.begin()+1+i);
00096                         
00097                         return 0;
00098                 }
00099         }
00100         PRINT_ERROR("Could not find branch %s \n", branch);
00101 
00102         return 1;
00103 }
00104 
00105 /*
00106  *  Extracts the branches from the options string. 
00107  */
00108 int HybfsData::parse_branches(const char *arg)
00109 {
00110         PathCrawler pc(arg, ROOT_SEP);
00111         
00112         if (branches.size() != 0)
00113                 return 0;
00114 
00115         ABORT((arg[0] == '\0'), "HybFS: No branches specified! \n");
00116 
00117         /* parse the options. This follows the model: "dir1:dir2:dir3" */
00118         while (pc.has_next()) {
00119                 string next = pc.get_next();
00120                 const char * branch = next.c_str();
00121                 if (strlen(branch) == 0)
00122                         continue;
00123                 add_branch(branch);
00124         }
00125 
00126         return branches.size();
00127 }
00128 
00129 const char * HybfsData::get_branch_path(int brid)
00130 {
00131         if (brid < 0 || brid > (int) branches.size())
00132                 return NULL;
00133 
00134         return branches[brid].c_str();
00135 }
00136 
00137 int HybfsData::get_nlinks()
00138 {
00139         int i, nlinks;
00140         int size;
00141         struct stat st;
00142         int ret;
00143         
00144         memset(&st, 0, sizeof(st));
00145         
00146         size = branches.size();
00147         nlinks = 0;
00148         
00149         for(i = 0; i< size; i++) {
00150                 ret = lstat(branches[i].c_str(), &st);
00151                 if(!ret)
00152                         nlinks += st.st_nlink;
00153         }
00154         
00155         return nlinks;
00156 }

00158 int HybfsData::virtual_readdir(const char *query, void *buf, filler_t filler)
00159 {
00160         int i, size;
00161         int ret = 0;
00162         
00163         size = vdirs.size();
00164         /* call a virtual readdir for each branch */
00165         if(strcmp(query,"/") == 0) {
00166                 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
00167                         ret = vdirs[i]->vdir_list_root(buf, filler);
00168                         if(ret)
00169                                 break;
00170                 }
00171         } else {
00172                 for(i=0; i<size; i++) {
00173                         ret = vdirs[i]->vdir_readdir(query, buf, filler);
00174                         if(ret)
00175                                 break;
00176                 }
00177         }
00178         return ret;
00179 }
00180 
00181 int HybfsData::virtual_addtag(const char* tag, const char* path)
00182 {
00183         string *abspath;
00184         int brid;
00185         int res, taglen, pathlen;
00186         string stag;
00187         file_info_t *finfo = NULL;
00188         struct stat st;
00189         
00190         vector <string> *tags = new vector<string>;
00191         boost::char_separator<char> sep("+ ");
00192         
00193         
00194         taglen = strlen(tag);
00195         pathlen = strlen(path);
00196         memset(&st, 0, sizeof(struct stat));
00197         
00198         /* the tag, or conjunction of tags must come surrounded by '(' and ')' */
00199         if(tag[0] != '(' || tag[taglen-1] != ')') {
00200                 delete tags;
00201                 return -EINVAL;
00202         }
00203         /* strip the tag */
00204         stag.assign(tag+1, taglen-2);
00205         /* break the query in multiple tags */
00206         path_tokenizer tokens(stag, sep);
00207                 
00208         /* get the absolute path */
00209         abspath = resolve_path(this, path, &brid);
00210         if(abspath == NULL) {
00211                 res = -ENOMEM;
00212                 goto out;
00213         }
00214         
00215         res = lstat(abspath->c_str(), &st);
00216         if (res) {
00217                 res = -errno;
00218                 goto out;
00219         }
00220         
00221         finfo = (file_info_t *) malloc(sizeof(file_info_t) + pathlen);
00222         if(finfo == NULL) {
00223                 res = -ENOMEM;
00224                 goto out;
00225         }
00226         /* the path always comes absolute */
00227         finfo->namelen = pathlen;
00228         memcpy(&finfo->name[0], path+1, pathlen);
00229         finfo->name[pathlen-1] = '\0';
00230         
00231         finfo->fid = st.st_ino;
00232         finfo->mode = st.st_mode;
00233         
00234          for (path_tokenizer::iterator tok_iter = tokens.begin();
00235                tok_iter != tokens.end(); ++tok_iter) {
00236                  DBG_PRINT(" I have: #%s# \n", (*tok_iter).c_str());
00237                  tags->push_back(*tok_iter);
00238          }
00239         res = vdirs[brid]->vdir_add_tag(tags, finfo);
00240 
00241 out:    
00242         if(abspath)
00243                 delete abspath;
00244         if(tags) {
00245                 tags->clear();
00246                 delete tags;
00247         }
00248         if(finfo)
00249                 free(finfo);
00250         
00251         return res;
00252 }
00253 
00254 int HybfsData::virtual_replace_query(const char *oldq, const char *newq, int brid)
00255 {
00256         return vdirs[brid]->vdir_replace(oldq, newq);
00257 }
00258 
00259 int HybfsData::start_db_storage()
00260 {
00261         int ret;
00262         
00263         for(int i=0; i< (int) vdirs.size(); i++) {
00264                 ret = vdirs[i]->init();
00265                 if(ret)
00266                         return ret;
00267         }
00268         
00269         return 0;
00270 }
00271 
00272 HybfsData::~HybfsData()
00273 {
00274         branches.clear();
00275         try{
00276         for(int i=0; i< (int) vdirs.size(); i++) {
00277                 delete vdirs[i];
00278         }
00279         } catch(exception) {
00280                 PRINT_ERROR("Failed to destroy FS data!\n");
00281         }
00282         vdirs.clear();
00283 }
